column4: hi,i just installed a new cd rom drive but ubuntu does not detect it..i see it in /media/cdrom. i cannot use it? any ideas?
what are trying to do with what
what is on the disk in the driver
i tried different cds (.iso,audio,movie) nothing works...
you don't mount a blank cd for writing
oh ok..but how can it detect it? i go to brasero and says "insert a blank cd" (it is already in)
if it is a cd and you want to expand an iso on it sudo wodim -eject -tao speed=96 dev=/dev/scd0 -v -data /path/to/image.iso
if it is a dvd and you want to exxpand an iso on it sudo growisofs -dvd-compat -Z /dev/scd0=/path/to/image.iso
so i have to do everything via terminal? is there a way to fix it permanently? to mount eveytime i plug a cd in no matter what is on the cd?
i believe mounting drives is configurable in fstab but i dont remember what it is
ok i ll search in google, just wanted to know where to focus...thnx
but blank media you dont need to do anything but know where your device is unless using the graphical burning software
